metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14975 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The FoFiType1C::convertToType0 function in FoFiType1C.cc in Poppler 0.59.0 has a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability because a data structure is not initialized, which allows an attacker to launch a denial of service attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7').
